sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using matrix methods:

2x + 3y + z = 8  
x - y + 2z = 3  
3x + 4y - z = 2
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using matrix methods, we will first represent the system as an augmented matrix:

```
[ 2  3  1 |  8 ]
[ 1 -1  2 |  3 ]
[ 3  4 -1 |  2 ]
```

Now, we will perform Gaussian elimination to get the matrix in row-echelon form:

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 2 to have a 1 in the top-left corner:

```
[ 1 -1  2 |  3 ]
[ 2  3  1 |  8 ]
[ 3  4 -1 |  2 ]
```

Step 2: Replace Row 2 with Row 2 - 2 * Row 1 and Row 3 with Row 3 - 3 * Row 1:

```
[ 1 -1  2 |  3 ]
[ 0  5 -3 |  2 ]
[ 0  7 -7 | -7 ]
```

Step 3: Divide Row 2 by 5:

```
[ 1 -1  2 |  3 ]
[ 0  1 -3/5 |  2/5 ]
[ 0  7 -7 | -7 ]
```

Step 4: Replace Row 1 with Row 1 + Row 2 and Row 3 with Row 3 - 7 * Row 2:

```
[ 1  0  7/5 | 19/5 ]
[ 0  1 -3/5 |  2/5 ]
[ 0  0  0  |  0  ]
```

Since we have a row of zeros at the bottom, we can see that the system has a unique solution. Now, we will perform back-substitution to find the values of x, y, and z:

From Row 2: y - (3/5)z = 2/5 => y = (2/5) + (3/5)z
From Row 1: x + (7/5)z = 19/5 => x = (19/5) - (7/5)z

Now, we can express the solution in terms of z:

x = (19/5) - (7/5)z
y = (2/5) + (3/5)z
z = z

Let z = t, where t is any real number. Then the solution is:

x = (19/5) - (7/5)t
y = (2/5) + (3/5)t
z = t

This is the general solution to the given system of linear equations.
